content.step1: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 8-inch round cake pans, lining the bottoms with parchment paper circles for easy release. Set aside and gather all ingredients: 2 cups flour, 1 ¾ cups sugar, half cup cocoa powder, 2 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp vanilla, 2 tbsp buttermilk, 1 cup milk, ½ cup melted butter, 2 eggs, 1 cup boiling water, and a pinch of orange zest for subtle lift.
content.step2: In a large mixing bowl whisk the dry ingredients: flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, and vanilla until combined. Add the melted butter, milk, buttermilk, and eggs. Beat on medium speed until smooth and slightly glistening, about 2-3 minutes, ensuring no lumps remain.
content.step3: Slowly pour in the boiling water, whisking until the batter is silky smooth. The batter will look a bit thin, but that’s normal. The hot water activates the cocoa and helps make the cake tender. Let the batter rest for 5 minutes to allow bubbles to settle.
content.step4: Divide the batter evenly between the prepared cake pans. Tap the pans gently on the counter to remove air pockets. Place them in the oven and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out mostly clean with a few crumbs attached.
content.step5: Remove cakes from oven and let them cool in the pans for 10 minutes. Then run a knife around edges, flip onto a wire rack, and continue cooling completely, about 15-20 minutes. Once cold, layer frosting of your choice: a classic buttercream or a chocolate ganache.
content.step6: Decorate with fresh berries or chocolate shavings for elegance. Slice with a sharp knife, serve, and enjoy the moist, decadent chocolate cake that feeds eight guests perfectly. Enjoy!
